Alchemy across the salt, for instance, demands a number of odd instruments that cannot be readily found at market. Could you create me precision tools with which to perform my studies?

Don't Ask about the Rivets<tab>I've only just opened shop here in the capital, but I've already gotten an awfully bizarre request for a black riveted mask that covers the entire head. ...I'm not about to judge, but these big city folk sure have interestin' tastes. Do you think you could fix me somethin' to reference?

Backing up My Words<tab>Thwarted by my shield and sabatons, my sweet students now attack me from behind! They heed my wisdom well and constantly seek weakness in their quarry. Yet now that quarry suffers from back pain─I shall need some of that spiked armor that all the fashionable warriors are wearing. Then I will be truly invincible.

A Hand for a Deckhand<tab>Any sailor worth his salt is a master of ropework. Only, when yer at sea for moons on end, ye can't help but long fer a pair of sturdy gloves what can keep yer hands from chafin'. The wind and water can sting somethin' wicked... Ye think you could help me out?

Essays on Equipment<tab>Passionate though they are for martial training, our members show little concern towards maintaining their kit. Leg armor purchased just recently is now unfit for use due to neglect and carelessness. Those responsible have been assigned essays on the importance of equipment maintenance, but we require replacements for the damaged armor nonetheless.

On Board for Lar<tab>Quality metal is in high demand these days due to all the development they're doing in Xak Tural with foreign technologies. I'm bound to make good coin if I specialize, so I need as many Lar ingots as you can manage.

Pendulums of Our Own<tab>In accordance with our study of healing techniques used by foreign sages, the Wing of Reflection currently hopes to develop nouliths whose energy transmissions are comparable to foreign models. We would be much obliged to the artisan who can craft us a weapon of Sharlayan design, but made of Turali metal.

Guaranteed Gem<tab>Y come from deep yn the countrysyde, so Y'm not used to sellyng wares yn a cyty lyke Tulyyollal. My boss tells me my accent ys too strong and that customers don't understand when Y explayn complycated products. But yhuykanyte always sells, so please make me some yhuykanyte!

Fan of the Foreign<tab>The sword, the lance, the bow─an instructor must be versed in all manner of weaponry. But the other day, I saw an adventurer from across the salt wielding a fan made of metal. What fascinating innovation! I, too, must learn how to defeat my foes with a pair of metal fans.

Shiny and Good<tab>A customer came askyng for somethyng specyal to gyve theyr sweetheart, but Y don't know the fyrst thyng about what cyty people lyke... Maybe somethyng wyth pynk beryl yn yt? Yt's so sparkly that anyone would love yt! Could you polysh me some pynk beryls, please?

Sew Excited<tab>Thanks to increased communication with foreign nations, our selection of available materials has grown immensely. You can imagine our joy as seamsters─so many gorgeous fabrics! I simply must have new tools with which to express my passion.

Orders Anonymous<tab>Y don't understand thys next order. An anonymous clyent wants a spyky mask that covers the mouth? Maybe Y heard wrong...unless thys ys the heyght of Tulyyollal fashyon!? Y hope you can make thys, because Y could never...

Ringing Gratitude<tab>The Resplendent Quarter's previous chairman provided us with many long years of service, heralding back to our district's inaugural years. Our committee has decided to commission a commemorative ring as a small token of our thanks. I believe something made in white gold will be well received.

The Right Rod<tab>We wish to equip our arcane practitioners with quality instruments that meet their various needs. There is a particular dark steel not typically used in Tural which I believe would be well suited for our traditional divinatory practices. We would be much indebted to the artisan able to create us such a rod.

Mask Maker<tab>Another order for a byzarre mask... Y dydn't thynk Baysyde Fancyes catered to that sort of thyng, but you learn a lot yn the byg cyty. Thys tyme the mask ys made of a shyny stone called “black star.” Looks lyke a pyece of the future, yf that makes any sense. Yt may be our fancyest pyece yet!

Tenets of Tanning<tab>I may have just opened up shop, but I'm no stranger to the tenets of leatherworkin'. The skin we use is a precious gift from the livin' creature it came from, and as a proud Hhetsarro, it's my duty to honor its sacrifice. Which is to say, I'd appreciate help with my tannin', so long as whoever does it fully understands the responsibility.

The Perfect Accessory<tab>My byg brother ys a leatherworker, so Y often suggest leather pyeces to my own customers. No matter who you are or what you wear, a chyc leather bracelet wyll always fyt your style. Workyng yn sales has never been so easy! Can you make me somethyng lyke that? Somethyng daryng?

Freezing Fingers<tab>A dirigible only arrives at its destination by the skill and precision of its pilot. As our vessels can reach freezing altitudes, we must take care that our pilots' hands don't go numb with cold. Could you make us something sturdy enough to block the wind, but that still allows for precision?

Dreams of Ja<tab>I just got a Tonawawta customer askin' for an outfit that'll make them look like a Mamool Ja. Before you ask─I don't question, I just do my job. I'm thinkin' I can make a mask out of crocodileskin, but the detailin' will take some time. If you could make some leggin's to match, I'd be much obliged.

Respect for Br'aax<tab>People of the Xbr'aal honor the br'aax as one of Tural's most outstandin' creatures. Processin' such an important skin requires time, consideration, and skill. While I don't lack for any of these things, I'd be grateful for an extra pair of hands to help replenish my stock.

Lending Artisans a Hand<tab>Povlu's Peddlery endeavors to meet the needs of patrons in all corners of the continent, our trade routes and outposts like the vast network of roots in a dense jungle! Tural is home to myriad artists who create works of the highest quality, and I believe such masterful hands are deserving of masterfully crafted gloves.

Freezing Toes<tab>Our pilots complain not only of cold hands, but cold feet as well. Considering how long they spend stationary at the helm, it's little wonder we hear grumbling about frigid toes. Supposedly, a popular new style of boot seen around the city is ideal for the job, and so we'd like to supply our pilots with a few pairs.

Giving Gatherers Their Gear<tab>With diverse clientele comes diverse needs, especially when you consider the particularities of each culture. But all peoples of Tural have one thing in common─a reliance upon the bounties of nature. That's why gear for gatherers is guaranteed to sell well, and we're always keen to replenish our stock!

Worqor Zormor or Bust<tab>I received an order for shoes from a traveler plannin' a solo expedition to the top of Worqor Zormor. Seems to me like winnin' over the Yok Huy would be more important than commissionin' a pair of shoes, but that's no business of mine. I think linin' the inside with gargantua leather should make 'em comfortable enough for a climb.

Just Generally Freezing<tab>We've given them new gloves and new boots, but now our pilots say they want new <var 1A 02 /var>clothes<var 1A 01 /var>! ...I suppose they've been enduring the cold without complaint for a while now. If we could provide them with something made of gargantua leather, I'm sure it would make all the difference. It had better, anyway...

Comfy Cabins<tab>Since we began hosting Sunperch's honored guests, our humble establishment has achieved new repute. As such, we aspire to furnish our rooms with the finest of luxuries, and our bedclothes are no exception. Cloth made from Urqopacha snow cotton should be just what we require.

Begin with the Basics<tab>Our shop has long upheld its prestigious reputation as the palace's personal tailors. Before we entrust any of our orders to outside artisans, we must first ensure a basic level of quality can be met. Create me a simple cotton jacket─and be aware that not a single stitch will go without scrutiny.

Cloth for Canvas<tab>My work in painting myriad landscapes takes me to every corner of Tural, but the rural settlements I visit often have nothing in the way of canvases. I've taken to preparing my own panels, but I find myself short on fabric. If an artisan would be kind enough to weave me a fine linen for my paintings, I would be deeply grateful.

In Line with Linen<tab>Our previous request was filled to satisfaction, so next we would test our candidates for style. One of our shop's most coveted items is an airy cloak made of linen. We ask that this piece be recreated with a particular attention to the full-body silhouette.

Weaving the Envelope<tab>Weight is a primary concern when it comes to dirigibles, which means all our materials must be both light and strong. Additionally, the envelope's fabric must be airtight─not to mention resistant to open flame. We can treat the fabric for the latter, but we need an expert weaver to prepare us a sufficient amount of fine sarcenet cloth.

Traditional Trousers<tab>Now I would like to test candidates on their understanding of traditional Turali clothing. Weavers in our employ must not only demonstrate peerless needlework, but also a deep understanding of our culture. Create a pair of bottoms from sarcenet cloth that proves your knowledge and dedication to our history.

Halfgloves, Full Effort<tab>A large order is due to arrive from the palace, so I must soon select candidates to assist us with this work. As a final challenge, I would have artisans create a pair of halfgloves woven from the wool of a Turali beast.

Cruel Climates<tab>Xak Tural is home to unforgiving climates, so gatherers must take extra care when preparing their gear. Our most common requests are for durable, comfortable, and warm clothing, so I think something made from rroneek wool will do nicely.

Glamorous Gloves<tab>Povlu's Peddlery caters to a wide range of clientele─we even fill orders from the palace on occasion! Our latest request is for a pair of fine silk gloves for some ceremony or another. We thought to entrust this task to an artisan with ample experience.

Silk for Sunperch<tab>The time has finally come to fulfill our order from Sunperch. We will be preparing ceremonial outfits of silk, and while our own tailors will create the necessary gloves and breeches, select artisans will be commissioned to fashion the overcoats. Only garments that embody both beauty and perfection shall be accepted.

Fast-forwarding Flora<tab>To better support the health of our nation's leaders, we regularly incorporate the knowledge of foreign practices in our research. Our latest endeavor requires a suitable growth reagent to confirm the effects of our medicinal flora. Would you be able to provide such a thing?

Big Brush, Big Dreams<tab>I was walking through the capital the other day when I saw a young lady carrying a giant brush across her back. What kind of art does one create with such a tool? I must try it for myself. If you could craft me a large angle brush, I would be much obliged.

Binding Spells<tab>The Wing of Reflection has seen fit to task the Nest of Learning with adapting tomes of foreign arcanists to suit our needs, which includes rebinding with local materials. As few experts in the creation of foreign tomes conduct business in Tuliyollal, we are petitioning the support of individual artisans who possess the skill and dedication required for such a task.

For Tired Minds<tab>Day in and day out, our leaders deliberate over the future of this nation, and it is evident their minds grow weary from the effort. As the palace apothecary, I wish to do my part to support them alongside my colleagues, and so I would like to commission a concoction that enhances mental acuity.

I Like Big Brush and I Cannot Lie<tab>The giant brush I commissioned is predictably not suited for detail work, but its large strokes are ideal for more direct expressions of emotion. I may be on the verge of discovering a new personal style, and so I would next try my hand at painting with a round brush.

Cutting Edge of Culinary Quality<tab>Every dish we place upon the tables of Vollok Shoonsa must be unmatched in flavor and flawless in presentation. Which is to say, our chefs' knives should slice with peerless precision! We are in need of whetstones capable of accommodating such exacting standards.

All-night Crafting<tab>Some of the divinatory rituals performed at the palace require the production of arcane instruments in considerable quantities. The artisans tasked with their creation often work through the night, and so I would like to offer them support in the way of an alchemical potable.

Something Salty and Ceremonial<tab>The leather-bound grimoires we commissioned have proven popular with our mages, and all have expressed eager interest in foreign geometries. We now have a need for books fit for ceremonial purposes─that is to say, books as beautiful as they are practical. A taste of salt would also not go amiss.

Tome for Tradition<tab>As a representative of the Wing of Reflection and keeper of the Nest of Learning, it gladdens me to see our collection of books grow. We've received another order, this time for a tome to be used in the palace. It should go without saying that what we require is a masterwork, pages resilient enough to be passed down through the ages as our nation continues to flourish and prosper. Naught less will suffice for a request from the Dawnservant.

Remedy for Reason<tab>The Vow of Reason is always expected to make rational decisions that shape the very fate of our nation. Such a burden surely invites great worry, which is why I would offer him a tonic to soothe both mind and spirit.

More Mezcal<tab>There's simply no cooking my tacos without mezcal. It's key to the meat's savory flavor! I use just enough that even those averse to drinking still love my tacos, but they sell quickly, and I fear I may run out of mezcal. I would be forever thankful to anyone who can replenish Aunt Tii's supply.

Friends Are Food<tab>You may know alpacas as sweet companions on the road, but they sweeten a Turali dinner table just as well as any other meat. We make it a point to honor every part of a creature's life, you see, whether in service or as sustenance. The Pelupelu often eat us out of stock, so we always appreciate extra hands in preparing alpaca dishes.

Don't Knock It Till You've Tried It<tab>Travelers from across the salt are regularly shocked by our swampmonk. It's not a meat that sounds appetizing, but when you trap its natural flavors in a mezcal marinade, it makes an addictively delicious dish. Help us fill our orders and you'll see what I mean.

Not-so-secret Ingredient<tab>Our tacos' secret ingredient is royal maple syrup. Why share the secret? Because only the truly skilled can make tacos that rival ours. The syrup's rich sweetness enhances the meat and spices, making it an invaluable ingredient I use daily. I'd greatly appreciate a replenishing of our stock.

Simple Is Hardest<tab>Xbalyav Ty'e is known for more than its odder entrees─in fact, our most popular dish is a modification of a simple foreign pasta. Of course, the simpler the dish, the more scrutiny falls upon the skills of its chef. Can you make a peperoncino that can satisfy our customers' discerning tastes?

Creative Chocolate<tab>In Tural, we mainly use kukuru beans for beverages, but I hear that across the salt, chocolate has advanced the creation of confectionary to a surprising degree. I believe something like that might be suitable for our tables. The embrace of a chewy crust around a decadent center...a union of bitter and sweet... I trust you can create something like that for me to emulate?

Bring Me Your Tacos<tab>Thanks to the city's support, Aunt Tii's Tacos has been named one of Tuliyollal's most popular food stands! But to remain popular in a city filled with taco-lovers, one must humbly continue to study and grow. That's why I'd like to sample the tacos of any and all who feel confident in their culinary talents. Go on, put me to shame if you can!

Najoothie<tab>In honor of Dawnservant Gulool Ja Ja's Mamook heritage, we ensure that dishes featuring Ja Tiika bananas are always available at the palace. Of particular popularity is the smoothie we offer each morning, so we would like to request a beverage of comparable taste and quality.

Sweet, Sweet Bean Juice<tab>Aunt Tii's Tacos also offers drinks, but finding flavors to match so many taco combinations is harder than you might think. That's when Aunt Tii had a brilliant revelation─a juice as sweet as alpaca's milk and pressed from mesquite beans would be guaranteed to refresh and satisfy!

Ocean Explosion<tab>Of all our offerings, I'm most proud of my acqua pazza─a dish bursting with the bounties of the ocean. It sells well, I'm pleased to say, but I simply don't have time to personally prepare each dish. You seem to handle yourself well enough in a kitchen, so can I ask you to take a few plates off my hands?

Reading Reeds<tab>Our organization aids in the production and management of crops across the varying regions of Tural. Predicting the yield from the Fields of Gold is one such important duty, so we seek gatherers willing to fetch us samples of reeds for analysis.

Brushing Up on Flowers<tab>Whether you need parcels shipped or goods procured, Povlu's Peddlery is here to help. A flower shop has requested something bold and striking for their wares, so I thought some shaggy orange brushflowers might be just the thing. Grab us a bunch, won't you?

All Stars<tab>Our divinators measure not only the heavens but myriad indicators upon the land as well, the reports of which go directly to the Dawnservant. Of particular interest are the starlike flowers that commonly grow in wetlands, as their color and shape predict the fortunes of the coming season. We would be much obliged to the gatherer who can fetch us some for research.

Evaluating Energies<tab>Last time we requested crop samples, but understanding the land itself is just as important to their maintenance. To measure the flow of earthly energies, we request gatherers collect us the leaves and sprouts of scarlet grasses that grow directly above crucial energy wells.

Plants Aquatic<tab>My request today comes from a Sharlayan botanist, if you can believe it! They need samples of giant aquatic plants for their research on water purification, so we'd be grateful if you could provide us with prime specimens.

First Beasts, Now Bugs<tab>The Landsguard is tasked with maintenance of Many Fires and other key transportational waypoints. Planting flowers with a distasteful smell to local beasts is a common practice, but with those flowers comes a variety of pests. Any assistance in ridding our plants of predatory insects would be greatly appreciated.

Herbs for Hurts<tab>It is our duty as palace apothecaries to keep our leaders hale and hearty. As a child, Third Promise Wuk Lamat would often bring us bumps, scrapes, and bruises...and I'm afraid little has changed over the years. Luckily, Tural is home to a number of plants with healing properties, so we would like an adequate supply of Urqolupin to be delivered as soon as possible.

Good Ear for Corn<tab>Corn is one of Tural's most ubiquitous crops, and when it comes time to harvest we come to rely heavily upon the Yok Huy's assistance. Having said that, we could use all the hands we can get─please help us reap this season's abundant yield of corn.

Trusty Trees<tab>Sturdy trees are essential for protecting public roads from soil degradation. We hope to transplant hardy specimens into areas prone to landslides, but must perform further testing on the seeds of certain species to determine their viability.

Sip of Scalebud<tab>When Gulool Ja Ja founded this nation, he brought with him the rich wisdom of the Mamool Ja, which continues to support the palace in a variety of ways. The scalebuds native to the Ja Tiika Heartland are known to make effective medicine when boiled─yet they emit a foul odor when crushed. Take care when harvesting, but we would greatly appreciate as many as you can safely gather.

Sacred Sap<tab>Incense created from trees of living light is essential to Mamool Ja divinatory practices. The sap of these celestially influenced trees is possessed of heavenly energies and thus makes for a valued ingredient. To keep our rituals running without mishap, we request more sap of living light.

New Start for the Cinderfield<tab>As proposed by the Vow of Reason, a restoration of the Xobr'it Cinderfield is currently underway. It will be no small task given the level of harm inflicted upon the land. We would greatly appreciate samples of charred plant life from the cinderfield, that we may assess the damage done not only to the soil, but also to the land's natural flow of energy.

Stopping Soapweed<tab>Until the introduction of locomotives, the proliferation of soapweed was never an issue─now, it's growing rampant over our tracks. Not the most glamorous of jobs, but someone needs to clear away the weeds so our trains can run on schedule.

Need for Nopales<tab>Whether our customers hail from the north or south, Xbalyav Ty'e endeavors to satisfy all Turali tastes. Our menu is as diverse as it is flavorful, and whole grilled cactus leaves are one of our specialties. We'll prepare the sauce if you fetch the juicy nopales.

Girth of the Earth<tab>The length and girth of earth horns indicate the current state of groundwater and subterranean energies. We need gatherers to fetch us samples of these plants from lands currently being evaluated for cultivation─future agriculture depends on it!

Tough Tuff<tab>Healthy crops require healthy amounts of fertilizer, and the production of such material falls within the scope of our duties. Crushed soft volcanic rock is the perfect solution for undernourished soil, so we would like to request as much as you can fetch us.

Strong Arm for Stone<tab>My home of Urqopacha is in need of construction material, but we Pelupelu aren't suited for hauling great slabs of stone. Any strong miner willing to deliver us sizable hunks of rock would be applauded as a hero!

Old and Bubbly<tab>Even eighty years since the Skyruin rained its fury upon the land, some rock continues to boil like magma. Our contingent monitors this area for potential long-lasting effects upon nearby settlements, so if you could fetch us a number of rock samples, we would be most grateful.

Abandoned Architecture<tab>Long ago, the Yok Huy built gorgeous architecture high in the mountains. Such edifices are rarely erected these days, and the older ones are prone to crumbling and tumbling down the mountainside. We'd appreciate help clearing away the stone before it's swept further afield.

Mountain Fish<tab>Within the Wing of Reflection, the Nest of Learning records Tural's natural history and conducts a range of scientific research, as was recommended by the Second Promise upon its creation. Currently, we are exploring the theory that our mountains were once submerged in water given the large distribution of piscatory fossils. Any additional samples you have to contribute to our work would be greatly appreciated.

Gleamstone for Lazybones<tab>Prangkobiq wishes to honorably hand-lend the potsworn─but given the necessary busytasks, Prangkobiq cannot be carebothered. But if a kindly stuffseeker gathers the needthings instead, pinchproblem is solved. Go and gather some darkgleam stone so Prangkobiq can sleepnap.

Fuelgiving Passionwork<tab>Prangkobiq's potsworn is full of carethought and heartvim. Particular about stuffsource and picky about timesends...a big chorebother for Prangkobiq. Rewards will be given to lowlander in exchange for firebright abokixa─just save Prangkobiq from another dragfoot busytask!

Building the Banks<tab>Landsguard duties extend far beyond the land─we care for Tural's waters as well. In light of damage from the recent storm, reinforcements to riverside levees will be underway shortly, for which we will need an ample supply of sturdy stone.

Pebbles for a Path<tab>Today I bring a request from Sunperch itself. They are requesting material for a path to be set in their new garden. What could be better than stones smoothed by rapid waters, thought I? So we'll need a collection of the finest, smoothest pebbles you can find!

Sampled Starfall<tab>The fossils we previously received led to remarkable results! This time we would like similarly aged samples from land exposed by celestial impacts. The forests of Yak T'el should yield what we are looking for.

Material for a Mindgenius<tab>Potsworn is an artistic mindgenius... Whenever Prangkobiq checks, potsworn is either rockcrafting or rockdemanding. Even if Prangkobiq were gathering mindgenius, Prangkobiq would limpfall with tiredarms at this rate. Ample reward will be gladgiven to stuffseekers who can bring heapstock of bluecrystal.

Vestiges of War<tab>We have a solemn duty to study battlefields of the past. By understanding our history, we can better ensure that our land is never scorched by the brutalities of war again. If you would provide us with vestiges found upon the Xobr'it Cinderfield, we will analyze them for the sake of a peaceful future.

Plains, Stone, Fish<tab>After comparing the geology of drastically different environments, we have discovered a curious point of connection. If we could obtain similar samples from Shaaloani, we stand to revolutionize how we understand the history of both Yok and Xak Tural. Fossils or simple rock samples─we will happily accept whatever you can provide.

Burning Rival<tab>While I'm sure you know that ceruleum is one of Xak Tural's more valuable resources, have you heard of the promising material called burnslate? As the northern branch of Povlu's Peddlery, we simply must include some in our offerings!

No Takebacks for Workshirk<tab>Prangkobiq's potsworn has mastered craftskill and become shinebeacon for potsworn everywhere. With great joy does the potsworn praise Prangkobiq's stuffseeking─but Prangkobiq has done nothing but sleepnap. Yet having come this far, Prangkobiq realizes there are no takebacks when it comes to workshirk. Fetch underwater shinestone for Prangkobiq and accept the reward!

Axing for Fish<tab>Recently, I've been pondering regional Turali folklore, specifically that of the Yok Huy. One story claims that, having faced a crushing loss, their greatest warrior came to the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Sunken Stars<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> to weep. Despondent, the warrior threw their beloved axe into the water, where it transformed into a fish. I would like to examine such a specimen in closer detail, if you can catch one. <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Requires: Fishing Tackle<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>

Full Moon Frogs<tab>A number of traditional ceremonies are carried out in the palace, some of which specifically honor our nation's leaders. When we pray for their health during the full moon, the voices of arcane practitioners must be joined with those of singing frogs. Should you travel to the land of the giants and dive into <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Karvarhur the First<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, you should find creatures suitable for our purposes. <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Requires: Spearfishing Gig<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>

Travel by Turtle<tab>When divining the fortunes of travel, we release a turtle to swim in the palace pond. The shape it makes upon the water's surface tells us whether obstacles await upon the impending journey. You will find the leaf-like turtles we require in <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Bopo'uihih<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, where the Hanuhanu make their homes. <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Requires: Fishing Tackle<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>

Order for Odd Fish<tab>We've got an odd order from an even odder fishmonger: he says he's looking for a fish that's evenly spotted, thin as a plate, and that lives in the waters of a wide rainforest. Can't say I believe such a fish exists─and even if it did, I can't imagine what customer would buy it! Still, it'd be worth taking a dip in <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>the eastern waters of Marsh Ligaka<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> just in case. <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Requires: Spearfishing Gig<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>

Perilous Peaks Poga<tab>Truth be told, I hate landing at <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Peaks Poga<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> when I travel to Kozama'uka by boat. There are fish in that river with razor-sharp teeth that will leap out of the water to attack you─especially if you're Pelupelu or what they otherwise deem an edible size. The risk of deadly fish bites is not a price we should have to pay to do business there, so go forth and show those nasty biters who's in charge. <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Requires: Fishing Tackle<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>

Catch My Metaphor<tab><var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Karvarhur the First<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> is supposedly where the first Yok Huy was born, and thus it is a sacred locale. The story of their origin also makes mention of a giant fish that serves as a guide for souls. Though it may merely be metaphorical, I would nevertheless determine its species if possible. Deep beneath the water's surface surely lurks something ancient, and I would have you bring it to me. <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Requires: Spearfishing Gig<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>

Starry-finned<tab>Contrary to assumption, Yak T'el folklore also includes stories of the Yok Huy due to their presence there in ages past. For instance, a Yok Huy mage is said to have gathered the stars and sealed them within a fish, which is why the night sky is no longer visible from the depths of the forest. Perhaps you can still find stars gleaming within fish that swim in <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Cenote Jayunja<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>? <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Requires: Fishing Tackle<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>

Eeling Cleanse<tab>It is our duty as palace mages to lend an ear to ancient spirits. However, our bodies must first be cleansed by donning the mantle of an eel imbued with lightning energies. You will find such creatures in the depths of <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Iq Rrax Tsoly<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, a cenote found in the Xbr'aal's forests. <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Requires: Spearfishing Gig<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>

Fish Tacos<tab>Our tacos are delicious no matter their filling, but fish makes for an exquisite flavor indeed. The whitefish that fries up fluffiest can be caught in <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>northwest Yyasulani<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, which is a little far to travel every day, but not too far for a dedicated fisher like you, yes? <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Requires: Fishing Tackle<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>

Hungry Hungry Whalaqee<tab>My magicks allow me to summon phantasms of fish I consume in their entirety. Needless to say, I have partaken of many a piscatory dish, but not always in pursuit of acquiring arcane prowess─sometimes, I'm simply hungry. A species replete with rejuvenating energies is known to meander the depths of <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>northern Lake Toari<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. Perhaps you could fetch enough to satisfy my appetite.
